are you loading up the pre-made ships I included?
That\'s what the original idea for shuttles was before radially mounting them.

anyway back on track. i made a tri adapter for the original 1 meter engines (which where renamed to Kriffun Engines) I think I will altering the 1 meter kerlin engines a bit to make them seem like more than a scaled up version of kerlins. Also i will be rebalancing their power. currently they are merely twice as powerful as the 0.5 versions. however according to specs from Space X the Griffin engines will be more powerful than a mere twice their smaller counter parts. If I make it so Three can power the Failcan core to space with equal thrust they should make 900 thrust. and chug fuel. however I think i will up their power from their original 690 to like 750 and leave their fuel consumptions down. This should result in slower launch speed but more lifting capabilities.

When cost comes into play and needs balancing they will of course cost a good bit more than 9 kerlins.

Edit: first succsessful launch. It absolutly Crawls into space but the fuel savings get it there 'better' but defiantly less cool than the 9 variant.
It\'ll be friendlier on rigs that don\'t like massive engine clusters, and yet it still manages to look cool with three.
hmm. and though I am not a fan of the solution I have found a way to sort fo fix the trunk problem perhaps. Not sure
So since i will be making a 1 to 1.5 adapter i need a 1 meter tank. so Falcon 1 fans will be pleased (sort of)

made the tank and adapter. i gave the adapter the same slope as the Capsule to make it look neat.

Also, the top of the capsule is 1 meter I did this so you could place 1 meter stuff on top of it like for sat. launches and such.
